block.p: Amanda Bowie Moniz, a daughter of Judy and J. Webb Moniz of Armonk, N.Y., is to be married today to David Louis Lenter, a son of Kathryn and Richard A. Lenter of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. Rabbi Douglas E. Krantz is to officiate at the home of the bride's parents.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 28, graduated from Brown University, where they met.

Amanda Bowie Moniz, a daughter of Judy and J. Webb Moniz of Armonk, N.Y., is to be married today to David Louis Lenter, a son of Kathryn and Richard A. Lenter of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. Rabbi Douglas E. Krantz is to officiate at the home of the bride's parents.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 28, graduated from Brown University, where they met.

Mrs. Lenter went on to receive a certificate in pastry arts from the New York Restaurant School and is the pastry chef at the BreadLine, a bakery and cafe in Washington. Her father retired as a partner in Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton, the New York law firm. Her mother is a dealer in antique English silver in Armonk.

Mr. Lenter, who received a law degree from Harvard University, is an associate in the tax group of Wilmer, Cutler & Pickering, the Washington law firm. His mother is a certified public accountant in Bloomfield Hills. His father is a lawyer in Southfield, Mich.
